intro: Locella cuneata, commonly known as the narrowleaf locella, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in the spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
